t: For the choir director; on the Gittith. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.
How*pn lovely are Your dwelling places, O*ln Lord*s of hosts!
My*ln soul longed and even yearned for the courts of the Lord;*s My*ln heart and my flesh sing for joy to the living God.
The*ln bird also has found a house, And*ln the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, Even*ln Your altars, O Lord*s of hosts, My*ln King and my God.
How*ln blessed are those who dwell in Your house! They*ln are ever praising You. Selah.
How*ln blessed is the man whose strength is in You, In*ln whose heart are the highways to*i Zion!*i
Passing*ln through the valley of Baca they make it a spring; The*ln early rain also covers it with blessings.
They*ln go from strength to strength, Every*iln one*i of*i them*i appears before God in Zion.
O*ln Lord*s God of hosts, hear my prayer; Give*ln ear, O God of Jacob! Selah.
Behold*ln our shield, O God, And*ln look upon the face of Your anointed.
For*ln a day in Your courts is better than a thousand outside.*i I*ln would rather stand at the threshold of the house of my God Than*ln dwell in the tents of wickedness.
For*ln the Lord*s God is a sun and shield; The*ln Lord*s gives grace and glory; No*ln good thing does He withhold from those who walk uprightly.
O*ln Lord*s of hosts, How*ln blessed is the man who trusts in You!
